alert.note: Alert for Christian; Daviess; Henderson; Hopkins; McLean; Muhlenberg; Todd; Webster (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 03 at 1:09PM EST until March 03 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Daviess County in northwestern Kentucky... Eastern Henderson County in northwestern Kentucky... Muhlenberg County in south central Kentucky... Eastern Christian County in south central Kentucky... McLean County in northwestern Kentucky... Todd County in south central Kentucky... Eastern Hopkins County in northwestern Kentucky... Northeastern Webster County in northwestern Kentucky... * Until 100 PM CST. * At 1209 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Providence to Oak Grove, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Owensboro, Madisonville, Central City, Elkton, Calhoun, Sebree, Guthrie, Livermore, Nortonville, Pembroke, Mortons Gap, Powderly, Graham, St. Joseph, Masonville, Stanley, Beech Grove, Greenville, Weir and Dunmor. This includes the following highways... Interstate 165 between Mile Markers 60 and 70. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 106 and 112, and between Mile Markers 119 and 139. Western Kentucky Parkway between Mile Markers 39 and 64. Pennyrile Parkway between Mile Markers 33 and 34. Audubon Parkway between Mile Markers 5 and 23. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CST for south central and northwestern Kentucky. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 400 PM CST for southwestern Indiana...and northwestern Kentucky. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CST for south central and northwestern Kentucky. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 400 PM CST for southwestern Indiana...and northwestern Kentucky.
